dcterms:creator: Richard Socher
Cliff C. Lin
Chris Manning
Andrew Y Ng
dcterms:description: Stanford Sentiment Treebank 2 (SST-2) comprises single sentences extracted from movie reviews for binary sentiment classification (positive vs. negative). Following GLUE, we consider sentence-level sentiment only, ignoring the sentiment labels of phrases provided by the original dataset.
dcterms:title: Stanford Sentiment Treebank 2 (SST-2)

dcterms:creator: Adina Williams
Nikita Nangia
Samuel R. Bowman
dcterms:description: The Multi-genre Natural Language Inference (MNLI) corpus is a large-scale, crowdsourced entailment classification dataset. The objective is to predict the relationship between a pair of sentences as one of entailment, neutrality, or contradiction.
dcterms:title: Multi-genre Natural Language Inference (MNLI)

dcterms:creator: Shankar Iyer
Kornl Csernai
dcterms:description: Quora Question Pairs (QQP) consists of pairs of potentially duplicate questions collected from Quora, a question-and-answer website. The binary label of each question pair indicates redundancy.
dcterms:title: Quora Question Pairs (QQP)

dcterms:creator: Alex Wang
Amapreet Singh
Julian Michael
Felix Hill
Omer Levy
Samuel R. Bowman
dcterms:description: GLUE is a multi-task benchmark and analysis platform for natural language understanding, comprising a collection of six natural language understanding tasks that are classified into three categories: single-sentence tasks, similarity and paraphrase tasks, and inference tasks.
dcterms:title: General Language Understanding Evaluation (GLUE)
